text: [5/12/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Yellow session. Red. Berries, apples, sweet, chewy, rounded. Really good and refreshing.
Bottle - Pours deep clear ruby, still. Great tartness that is just enough and not too cloying or sweet. Fabulous!

Bottle from Table and Vine. Pours light red with no head. Lots of tartness on the nose with the berry thing coming through. Very dry and tart on the tongue which pairs nicely with the black currant. Quite lovely.
Draft @ MBCC 2017. Pours a pale red color with a small white head. Has a fruity floral spicy black currant aroma. Fruity spicy apple and black currant flavor. Has a fruity spicy black currant finish.

Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, yellow session. Aroma is mostly floral with cherry blossom notes. Taste is a combination of sweet and tart, fruity with apple and cherry notes. Dry, astringent mouthfeel.
Keg at cbc17 yellow. Deep red... Thin white lacing. Msoft sweet cherries fruit nose.big dry cherry and apple.. Soft tanins
Tap @ MBCC 2017. Aromas of sweet apples, raspberries, floral notes. Taste is light tart, apples, raspberries, floral sweet notes in the back.
Sample at MBCC. Rose with a small head. Aroma light of berries. Flavor light sweet, honey spicy, dry. Medium body.
Sample @ MBCC, Yellow session. Fizzy reddish pour with a small head. Notes of juicy apples, berries and some light currants.
Tap @MBCC2017, Yellow Session. Clear purple, no head. Sweet berry aroma, strawberries. Bittersweet fruit and berry flavour. Cherries, strawberries.
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Yellow Session. Klare rötlich pinke Farbe. Geruch nach süßen Äpfeln, rote Beeren. Geschmack nach roten Beeren, süße reife Äpfel, leicht alkoholisch.
MBCC17; reddish color; fruity nose; Softdrink link but not too sweet, very fruity, pear, apple, berries

0,05l from tap at MBCC yellow session shared with / by the crew. redish / clear color. no head. smells medical, apples, light berry notes. decent smell overall. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of apples, lightly citric, some medical notes, some sweetness, bit peppery. finishes light to medium sweet with notes of apples, citrus and some medical notes. nice one overall

6, 4, 7, 3, 14

Schouskjelleren Ølfestival 2016. Red body with a tiny head. Aroma of blackcurrant, green apples and yeast, taste is acidic with berries, tart fruit, apple skin, mild spicy/herbal. Nice sour aftertaste. Pretty good!

Purple tinted red color and no head out of the tap. Berry candy nose. This had lots of tart apples, sweet berries and a long dry black currant flavor. The long dry finish ends like a chewed sweet tart candy. Really nice flavored cider.

Pour on tap at 3 Floyds, clear purple pour with thin to no head, aroma brought notes of sour berry, apple, oak, vanilla, some slight tannic and acidic notes. Taste was a mix of apple, oak, vanilla into some nice tart currant flavor, finishing acidic, dry, slight berry sweetness.

12 ounce bottle from State Line. Clear vibrant red, thin fizzy tan white head, decent retention. Aroma of currant, grape, sweet apple finish. Taste is tart currants, sweet apples. Medium bodied, crisp. Solid.

Sampled from the tap at GTMW 2016. Pours a pinkish red with no head whatsoever. Aroma has sweet honey with a slight dryness and some sweet currants supporting. Flavor has sweet honey and slightly tart currant.

Pours a rosy color with almost no head. Aroma is apple cider with berry undertones. Taste is sour sour sour black currents with apples trying to punch their way through in the mid. Its a valiant effort on the part of the apples, but the currants win in the end.
On tap @ B. Nektar. Pour is pale orange with no head. Aroma and flavor of black currant, caramel apples, raspberries, and sour apples. Finish / body is more like soda than a cider.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 12/23/2016. Bottle at the RateBeer DC Cider tasting. Clear amber orange. Aromas of champagne, white wine, berries, hibiscus. Tastes of berries, cherries, white wine. Light body with a dry finish. 7/4/7/4/14

2/3/2017. Bottle sampled at Dominion Wine & Beer. Thanks Tyler! Clear pinkish red color. Aromas of cherries, raspberries. Tastes of raspberries, cherries, tart fruit. Light body with a dry finish. Very tasty. 8/4/8/4/16

500 ml bottle from Cappys. Pours a clear reddish purple color with a small pinkish head. The aroma and flavor have tart berries and apples that carry some sweetness as well, dry, ok for what it is, the label is the best part.
Aroma is apples, fruit and mild sweetness. The flavor is apples, berries/black currant and a sweet/tart finish.
From a bottle at the RB cider tasting December 2016. Pours a clear rose with a scant head. Flavors of blackberry and currants. Smooth finish.

Bottle courtesy of Biggsbowler. Clear ruby pour with no head. Overripe apple nose with hints of berries and minerals. Slightly sweet and tiny sour. Round tiny tart mouth. Tart apple and berry finish. Not a huge fan of the apple profile in this one. Too overripe. Also would have liked a clearer black currant character.

Bottle. Light to moderate aromas of sour apple, white wine and cherry. Color is clear peachy red. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and sour. Palate is light, watery with a lively carbonation and a tart finish. Nice Cider with a sour ale aspect to it.
Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours bright red with a modest pink head and a fruity aroma. There is a sour currant flavor over an apple base. Very dry.

Draught at Brewers Beer Bar, Göteborg. Clear pale reddish color, no head. Fruity black currant aroma, apples, some caramel. Black currant flavor, apples, caramel, dark berries. Quite nice, very drinkable.

Hard to take this one. Exceedingly tart cranapple berry and apple flavor; aggressively so. Pours a cool light purple, and has an awesome bottle sporting a creative take on Black Sabbaths War Pigs. Difficult to put this one away.

This Cider pours a clear ruby color with a thin pinkish-white head that dissipates quickly to a film. Spotty lacing. Active carbonation. Aroma of apples, currant, sour berries and spice. Light body with flavors of tart apples and raspberries, with some spice in the background. The finish is fruity with a very tart almost sour berry aftertaste. Tastes like cranapple thats about 3 years out of date.

500 ml bottle shared with friends. The cider is a hazy, pale purple with no head. The aroma has nice black currant notes with a pleasant apple acidity playing well with it. Taste has predominantly currant and other berry notes. Lighter body, medium to high carbonation. Really nice stuff.

Bottle pours a clear pale pink with a large white/pink head. Aroma of apples a sweet currant. Taste of tart currant and sweet apples, nice effervescent carbonation, light palate. Crushable very tasty.

Pour from a 500 ml bottle. Really nice color - deep purple / red, a tiny white head. Apple and strong berry nose. Tart, slightly sweet, super refreshing and delicious. Pretty cool Black Sabbath-inspired lyrics printed on the bottle as well.
Bottle. Aroma is apple, pears, and black currant. Tastes like fruity apple cider. Sweet and tart. This is pretty delicious.
